intro: Descurainia cumingiana, commonly known as Cuming's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately divided leaves that are characteristic of the family. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
